name: Prasad Maruti Nayak
description: To modernize legacy systems, automate content workflows, and synchronize scheduling for improved scalability, operational efficiency, and content delivery speed. 1. Legacy CA ID De-Packaging & Migration Transition Protocols: Replace outdated CA identifiers with modern, secure alternatives. Seamless User Migration: Ensure minimal disruption during the transition. Backward Compatibility: Maintain support for legacy systems during the migration phase. 2. Automated Slate Services Synchronization Cross-Platform Scheduling Sync: Automate duplication of scheduling data across platforms. Metadata Alignment: Standardize content timing and metadata formats. Reduced Manual Coordination: Use automation to minimize human intervention. 3. Automation of In-House Content Management Workflow Optimization: Automate ingestion, processing, and publishing pipelines. Metadata Management: Improve tagging, categorization, and searchability. Reduced External Dependencies: Bring more control in-house for faster turnaround.

name: Prasad Maruti Nayak
description: The Red Button feature is commonly associated with interactive TV services, allowing users to access extra content or functionalities. Automating its scheduling means: - Setting predefined rules for when interactive options appear. - Streamlining activation triggers based on program types or audience engagement. - Ensuring synchronization with live broadcasts and on-demand services. This would eliminate manual scheduling, ensuring real-time and optimized user experiences.

name: Prasad Maruti Nayak
goal name: End-to-End Automation of XTI/XML File Processing
description: XML and XTI files often require manual handling in workflows, such as content ingestion, metadata extraction, and transformation before integration with other systems. Full automation would mean establishing pipelines that can: - Validate and parse XML/XTI files. - Extract key data fields automatically. - Apply necessary transformations (such as format standardization). - Route the data seamlessly to the required endpoints without manual intervention. This would improve efficiency, reduce errors, and enhance speed.

name: Prasad Maruti Nayak
goal name: Reconciliation of BI Report Channel and Channel Mapping in Pack
description: This involves analyzing how business intelligence (BI) report’s structure and present data compared to how channels are mapped within packaged configurations. The goal is to assess factors like data consistency, ease of integration, and automation potential. Differences could arise in how metadata is stored, how reporting visualizations align with operational mapping, and whether there’s room for improved automation to synchronize the two.

name: Prasad Maruti Nayak
description: To modernize access control and streamline content scheduling across platforms by: Replacing outdated CA identifiers with scalable, secure alternatives. Automating and synchronizing scheduling data across services. Key Components: 1. Unified Identity & Access Layer Modern CA ID System: Replace legacy identifiers with secure, scalable IDs (e.g., UUIDs, PKI-based). Access Gateway: Centralized service to authenticate and authorize users across scheduling platforms. Backward Compatibility Layer: Middleware to translate legacy IDs during the transition. 2. Scheduling Synchronization Engine Data Replication Service: Real-time sync of scheduling data across platforms using APIs or message queues. Metadata Normalization: Standard schema for content metadata (e.g., title, duration, tags). Conflict Resolution Logic: Rules to handle overlapping or conflicting schedules. 3. Automation & Monitoring Event-Driven Triggers: Automate updates when access or scheduling data changes. Audit & Logging: Track changes to both access credentials and scheduling data. Dashboard: Unified interface for monitoring ID transitions and scheduling sync status.

goal name: A. Analysis, Management, Configuration, Problem Resolving of Uplink & Downlink Chain
description: 1. Management of Uplink & Downlink Chain: Checking configuration and redundancy of Uplink Chain according to schedule & Provide resolution for all technical issues pertaining to RF Setup. 2. Management of Measuring & Spare equipment’s: Need to capture & analyze the issue observed in RF Uplink & Downlink setup timely & need to resolve issue in minimum time either by replacing equipment or by informing Broadcaster. 3. Uplink equipment failure: Configuring & replacing the faulty equipment of Uplink Chain with spare one. 4. Special Event Coverage: Arrange Satellite Downlink for any special event coverage on our platform. 5. Management of ASI signal to Diversity Site : Manage ASI traffic to Chennai via P2P lease line network of TCL/Vodafone / Airtel network .

goal name: B. Health Checkup & Preventive Maintenance of RF Setup
description: 1. Preventive maintenance, Health check-up of RF setup timely & ensures spare equipment’s availability for Uplink setup. 2. Ensure that SOP's are followed for routine jobs to maintain standards and all preventive procedures are followed. 3. Coordination with Vendors/ OEM’s for all equipment’s or any specific issues observed in setup at Delhi & Chennai. 4. Monitoring our downlink signals for any interference/ spurious detection, Inform ISRO /NOCC & co-ordinate with them to resolve the issue. 5. Ensure that the RF databases are always updated and reference documents regularly revised. Keep track of issues & implemented changes for future reference.

name: A. Manjunath
goal name: Analysis, Management, Configuration, Problem resolving of Uplink and Downlink chain.
description: • 24*7 Management of all sections of DR site as Uplink & RF chain, Downlink chain, Compression chain, Electrical supply system and subsystem for their proper functioning. • Periodic parameter calibration, firmware up gradation and log extraction of all broadcast equipment of uplink, downlink and compression & Scheduling Preventive Maintenance. • Regularly checked standby equipment which enable us to make sure standby will take the traffic in case of online equipment failures. • Taking care of integration, configuration & maintenance of the equipment used in Broadcast head end and down link chain, Compression chain & n-Compass system and uplink chain. • Constant keeping in touch with Delhi team in case of any activity as scheduled or non-scheduled, any equipment or chain breakdown or during any on air service missing or any alarm observed so that we can maximise our uptime and minimise the breakdown time.

name: A. Manjunath
goal name: Chennai DR Relocation- Project Planning, Implementation and Coordination.
description: • Planning and implementing the installation of a new setup & ensuring that a new project meets its timeline with accuracy involves several key steps. Also ensure that standard procedures are followed in the installation process and making the site ready. • Prompt follow up with vendors to ensure that RF and baseband chain equipment are delivered. • Coordination with all different stake holders to make sure those standard regulatory parameters of uplink and downlink are met for making the site operational. • Standard Procedures are implemented on dismantling, packing and safe transport to new site. Pre-emptive steps to be taken that day-to-day operation are unaffected during shifting and installation. • Identify the risks, Perform qualitative & quantitative risk analysis and plan for recovery or backup.

name: A. Manjunath
goal name: Innovation, Creativity, Learning, Internal Growth, & Additional Responsibilities
description: • Enhance professional scope through additional responsibilities and spearhead key internal improvement projects to drive organizational growth. • Proactively manage and resolve complex network problems to ensure uninterrupted signal transmission. • Involvement in Creativity, Innovation in DTH Field. Improving Skills and performance. And increase productivity. Support employees, maximizing the values of employee. • Create positive work environments in the Team and Organization by sharing and accepting feedbacks thus improving efficiency performance.

name: A. Manjunath
goal name: Robustness assessment of equipment and risk Management
description: • Pre-emptive health check-up and thereby identify risks and reduce operational costs. Proactive planning of preventive maintenance & maintain sufficient stock for ideal operation. • Detection of flaws and shortcomings in uplink and down link chain & compression issues and managing the workflows, maintain database along with report generation. Ensure SOPs are followed by the team to keep the health and safety of the equipment to the mark. • Ensure that the installation of equipment is done according to the procedure and required output is delivered. Follow up with Vendors for all Equipment’s or any specific issues observed in setup. • Trouble shooting of faulty equipment and make arrangement of required spares and tools for trouble shoot.

name: Sanat Kumar Mohanty
goal name: Ensuring Reliable Network Connectivity, Sustaining High Service Availability, Optimizing Network Performance, and Proactively Resolving Network Issues
description: 1) Ensure the Disaster Recovery (DR) site is fully prepared to support site failover in case the primary site encounters technical failures or adverse weather conditions. 2) Establish and follow a routine schedule for inspecting equipment to confirm that backup systems are fully functional and capable of seamlessly taking over in case of primary system failures, thereby maintaining continuous service availability. 3) Implement proactive network monitoring to diagnose issues and optimize performance, ensuring efficient service delivery within the defined service level agreements (SLAs). 4) Ensure the support team addresses user-reported network issues within established response times and maintain clear communication with vendors and internal stakeholders regarding network upgrades and scheduled maintenance activities.

name: Sanat Kumar Mohanty
goal name: Expanding Responsibilities Leading Internal Development Initiatives
description: 1) Facilitate cross-functional communication for project-related equipment procurement, closely monitor purchase order progress, and collaborate with the procurement team to accelerate PR/PO processing in alignment with managerial directives—ensuring timely delivery of equipment essential for ongoing project execution. 2) Strengthen professional development by taking on expanded responsibilities within current projects and contributing to internal process improvements that support overall organizational growth and project success. 3) Initiate and implement practical solutions to improve operational workflows, especially those impacting current project deliverables. Maintain a well-organized spare parts inventory to ensure immediate replacements and prevent delays in project timelines. 4) Actively pursue industry-relevant certifications and participate in training aligned with ongoing project requirements. Attend technical workshops and seminars to stay informed on emerging trends and apply acquired knowledge to enhance project outcomes.

name: Sanat Kumar Mohanty
goal name: Implementation and Relocation of New Project Infrastructure: Installation and Commissioning of New Setup
description: 1) Ensure the successful installation of the new setup by strictly following the defined project plan, achieving timely completion within the allocated budget. Maintain effective coordination with all internal stakeholders and vendors throughout the project lifecycle to ensure alignment, prompt support, and adherence to all project milestones. 2) Plan and execute the relocation of existing infrastructure to the new site with a strong focus on maintaining operational continuity. Follow standardized procedures for equipment uninstallation, secure packing, and safe transport, ensuring all equipment is carefully reinstalled to prevent damage and minimize service interruptions. 3) Install and configure new equipment and infrastructure in accordance with industry standards and best practices. Conduct rigorous post-installation testing—including functionality, performance, and reliability checks—to validate system readiness. Ensure a smooth operational transition by updating records, coordinating handovers, and clearly communicating shift activities to relevant team members. 4) Develop comprehensive documentation, including installation manuals, configuration logs, and troubleshooting guides. Manage vendor relationships to ensure timely deliveries, installation support, and compliance with quality standards. Implement continuous improvement strategies and update Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) to reflect the new setup, supporting future operations and maintenance efforts.

name: Sanat Kumar Mohanty
goal name: Performing Thorough Equipment Health Checks and Implementing Processes to Identify and Mitigate Operational Risks
description: 1) Evaluate the health of all systems to identify and mitigate risks of service disruptions and reduce operating costs. Perform routine preventive maintenance, verify RF setup standards, and ensure the availability of spare parts. 2) Diagnose and resolve issues within the baseband and compression chains, oversee workflows, maintain databases, generate reports, and ensure strict adherence to SOPs to ensure equipment health and safety. 3) Leverage findings from risk assessments to prioritize maintenance and replacements, and keep detailed records of equipment health evaluations, maintenance activities, and risk management measures. 4) Regularly update databases and ensure timely revisions of reference documents. Track and document issues and the changes implemented for future reference.

name: Sanat Kumar Mohanty
goal name: Reducing Service Interruptions, Expediting Issue Resolution, and Strengthening Reporting and Coordination for Tata Play Darshan Services.
description: 1) Collaborate with all fiber link service providers to maintain continuous data and stream transmission, with a particular focus on ensuring stable uplink connectivity from the Disaster Recovery (DR) site. 2) Assess the effectiveness of competitors’ rain outage management setups during the monsoon season, while ensuring timely fault logging in the MCR portal, disseminating relevant updates to stakeholders, and generating comprehensive daily, weekly, and monthly outage performance reports for Chennai and Mumbai. 3) Improve the precision and detail of incident documentation and reporting processes to enhance operational transparency and accountability. 4) Minimize the occurrence and impact of service disruptions to maintain consistent delivery of Darshan services. Strengthen interdepartmental coordination to support efficient issue resolution and service continuity for Tata Play Darshan.

goal name: DR Relocation Project – Strategic Planning, Seamless Coordination & Implementation.
description: • Design a detailed, phase-wise project execution framework capturing critical milestones, and key performance indicators. Clearly define all technical, operational, and logistical prerequisites to ensure a smooth and efficient relocation process. • Coordinate a well-orchestrated decommissioning of legacy infrastructure. Ensure that all systems are securely dismantled, transported, and reinstalled with integrity, meeting compliance and operational benchmarks. • Keep track of all project activities. Coordinate closely with vendors, technical teams, and other stakeholders to make sure everything goes smoothly. • Identify possible risks early. Analyze them and create plans to reduce their impact. Keep an eye on potential issues to avoid delays or mistakes. • Make sure the new setup is completed within the set timeline, with a focus on accuracy and efficiency. • Confirm that all equipment is installed properly and meets the expected performance levels. • Ensure all equipment is fully connected and communicating correctly with the Network Management System (NMS). • Aim to complete the move with minimal disruption to operations, ensuring a smooth switchover to the new site.

name: Jibo K. Varghese
goal name: Efficient and error free operations of the Uplink & Downlink Chain and the Live Darshan Services
description: Checking configuration and redundancy of Uplink Chain, proactively monitor the health of all the online and standby equipment through M&C and ensure all the parameters are in the normal range • Ensure site is ready for switching by maintaining an error free uplink chain. To provide error free online services, keep all the standby equipment ready. • To ensure equipment uptime of 100% with configured redundant system. in case of any failure of the online equipment and configuring & replacing the faulty equipment of uplink chain with spare one. • Collaborate effectively with OM Content, Shemaroo, BCIT, and Playout teams to proactively oversee the Darshan services infrastructure, aiming to reduce outages and enhance service stability. • Accurately log incidents and escalate issues to relevant teams via structured communication. Compile and maintain detailed operational reports on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis, while recording outage instances with clear cause identification in the MCR Application.

description: 1.1 Ensure High System Uptime and Updated Configurations: Design processes to maintain at least 99.95% uptime across systems, regularly update equipment configurations, and prepare for special event coverage. 1.2 Proactively Address Issues and Maintain Readiness: Analyse outages to identify root causes, ensure quick access to replacement devices during emergencies, and keep all processes and SOPs up to date. 1.3 Support Team Efficiency and Prevent Failures: Guide the team in using resources effectively, implement regular health checks and maintenance, and apply proactive monitoring to avoid future issues.

name: Asheesh Kumar
description: 2.1 Database and Software Management: Ensure databases are regularly updated, software modules are maintained, and reference documents are revised. Perform routine checks and updates for optimal system performance. 2.2 Issue Tracking and Reporting: Maintain records of issues and updates, coordinate with technology teams for resolutions, and analyze regular reports. Update SOPs to keep operations snag free and standardized. 2.3 Documentation and Support Tools: Keep detailed logs of activities and maintain updated escalation matrices, checklists, and templates to support quick responses to queries from the Call Centre, FSD, and Broadcasters.

name: Asheesh Kumar
description: 3.1 Ensure Smooth Operations: Regularly follow up with vendors and teams to fix technical issues and keep the Baseband equipment and software running smoothly. 3.2 Team Training and Support: Provide necessary training and updated documents to help the team understand processes and handle issues confidently. Make sure everyone is aware of system updates and SOPs. 3.3 Maintain Updated Systems and Supervision: Keep the MCR database and tools updated after every activity. Offer support to the team, especially new members, and ensure 24/7 manpower availability. 3.4 Additional reports: Preparing and sending the monthly regulatory reports every month within the provided timeline.

description: • Oversee a tight & optimised roadmap and ensuring we get the best bang for the budget • Acquisition levers like free trials, discounting, pack experiments, segmentation, partnerships (bundling with ISPs ), improve GTM & speed & build an effective AB testing framework • Search & personalisation to power more play clicks powered by richer metadata and leverage AI • Improved user and social experience on app helping to make Binge viral from within the product and make it more vibrant & relevant as a content expert • Help power engagement with better sports & live programming and automation for timely and quick publishing while getting more from partners - continue watching, engagement data, best practices etc • A higher focus on building experience qnd Visibility on large screens for Binge

name: Narendra Dwivedi
goal name: DR Relocation Project – Strategic Planning, Seamless Coordination & Implementation.
description: • Design a detailed, phase-wise project execution framework capturing critical milestones, and key performance indicators. Clearly define all technical, operational, and logistical prerequisites to ensure a smooth and efficient relocation process. • Coordinate a well-orchestrated decommissioning of legacy infrastructure. Ensure that all systems are securely dismantled, transported, and reinstalled with integrity, meeting compliance and operational benchmarks. • Keep track of all project activities. Coordinate closely with vendors, technical teams, and other stakeholders to make sure everything goes smoothly. • Identify possible risks early. Analyze them and create plans to reduce their impact. Keep an eye on potential issues to avoid delays or mistakes. • Make sure the new setup is completed within the set timeline, with a focus on accuracy and efficiency. • Confirm that all equipment is installed properly and meets the expected performance levels. • Ensure all equipment is fully connected and communicating correctly with the Network Management System (NMS). • Aim to complete the move with minimal disruption to operations, ensuring a smooth switchover to the new site.

name: Narendra Dwivedi
goal name: Innovation, Creativity, Learning, Internal Growth, & Additional Responsibilities.
description: 1) Enhance professional scope through additional responsibilities and spearhead key internal improvement projects to drive organizational growth. 2) Proactively manage and resolve complex network problems to ensure uninterrupted signal transmission. 3) Involvement in Creativity, Innovation in DTH Field. Improving Skills and performance. And increase productivity. Support employees, maximizing the values of employee. 4) Create positive work environments in the Team and Organization by sharing and accepting feedbacks thus improving efficiency performance.

name: Narendra Dwivedi
goal name: Preventive Maintenance, Scheduled Health Check-ups, Database Indexing, Focused Network Monitoring, Ownership, and Accountability.
description: • Proactively schedule preventive maintenance and routine health check-ups for the RF setup to ensure optimal performance and minimize downtime. • regular communication with vendors for procurement, servicing, and troubleshooting of RF and uplink equipment. Promptly escalate and coordinate resolution of any setup-specific issues through vendor support or internal technical teams. • Continuously monitor downlink signals for any interference, spurious emissions, or anomalies. • Keep RF system databases accurately updated with the latest configuration changes, issue resolutions, and component statuses. • Provide regular updates and detailed reports to higher management and stakeholders. • Maintain clear and prompt communication during issues, maintenance activities, and upgrades.

name: Narendra Dwivedi
goal name: To deliver a superior customer experience, enhance productivity, strengthen reporting, and reduce downtime caused by equipment failures.
description: • Ensure that services are consistently delivered within the agreed timeframe, meeting quality standards and customer expectations. • Streamline and improve operational workflows to boost efficiency and enhance team productivity across all departments. • Focus on creating clear, accurate, and timely reports that support better planning and faster decision-making. • Maintain high on-air service standards by actively monitoring content, analysing performance, and preparing daily reports to resolve issues before they affect users.

name: Narendra Dwivedi
goal name: To ensure robust, efficient, and uninterrupted functioning of the Uplink & Downlink Chain and uninterrupted delivery of Live Darshan Services.
description: • Regularly validate the configuration and redundancy setup of the uplink chain. Continuously monitor the status and performance of both primary and standby equipment through the M&C system to ensure all parameters remain within optimal operational thresholds. • Ensure the site is always ready for seamless switchover by maintaining a fault-free uplink chain. Ensure all reserve equipment is fully functional and prepared to take over instantly to support uninterrupted live transmissions. • Strive for 100% system uptime by utilizing configured redundant systems. Promptly address any failure in active equipment by configuring and deploying standby or spare units without delay. • Collaborate effectively with OM Content, Shemaroo, BCIT, and Playout teams to proactively oversee the Darshan services infrastructure, aiming to reduce outages and enhance service stability. • Accurately log incidents and escalate issues to relevant teams via structured communication. Compile and maintain detailed operational reports on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis, while recording outage instances with clear cause identification in the MCR Application.

name: Vipul Kumar
goal name: A. Monitoring, Fault Escalations and Technical operations
description: 1. Downlink Monitoring tools: Ensure all services are visible on the video wall. Use alarms (via KX and Sentry) for Downlink/Uplink signals to alert within 30 Sec of any outage. 2. Alarm System/Trap Management: Configure and manage Dektec, Sentry and Spectrum Analyzer tools to use to monitor Transport Streams and pull system logs. 3. Fault/Event logging: Log every outage in MCR software with details like downtime and RCA. Send emails to Co-tech, Leadership and Broadcaster as per the escalation Matrix. 4. FSD, Broadcasters and other Escalations: Respond to all issues within 15 mins, escalate technology related issues to the appropriate teams promptly. 5. Competitor Monitoring: Track competitor services and note down outages or A/V quality differences for benchmarking. 6. Service Availability: Maintain 99.95 % uptime across Baseband, Compression and Receive end chains. Ensure all services meet Broadcast Standard

name: Vipul Kumar
goal name: B. Headend operations, Database, SOP Update & Reports generation
description: 1. Service Execution: Perform Service Launch, Drop and modification as per the CR raised and follow checklists and share updates with stakeholders in the same shift. 2. Report Generation: Create and share Shift/ daily/weekly/monthly as schedule. Ensure reports are verified and shared with relevant teams on time. 3. Database Management: Update Monitoring, Compression and Baseband details update immediately after any changes. Use work orders and alerts to plan future works (Internal or Broadcaster related) 4. SOP Compliance: Folow SOP for all routing tasks and share Checklist updates. Share pending tasks via mail or handover tool. Revise SOPs whenever workflow changes. 5. Service Quality Checks: Validate and coordinate on any quality, Signal or Technical changes observed. Confirmed data accuracy with concerned Stakeholders. 6. Live activities: Providing support to Broadcasters, Content, Interactive teams during Live Events, Blocking Matches, Routing Informatory Slates and share recordings of Commercials on Geo based bouquets.

name: Vipul Kumar
description: 1. Compression: Handle encoder/MUX settings, check system health, update parameters, review error logs, replace faulty units, manage Data PIDs, and monitor services in transport streams. 2. Issue Escalation & Support: Report and follow up on issues like Stuffing, Data PID mapping / Unmapping, and ECM toggling. Coordinate with relevant teams and provide on-site support. 3. Equipment Health & Maintenance: Regularly check the health of all compression chain equipment via NCM. Keep backups ready, monitor alarms on encoders, MUX, nCC, and switches, and address outages as per SOP to reduce downtime. 4. Additional reports: Competitor EPG Details and Platform Services BW Comparison.

name: Meghna Tiwari
description: Lead the end-to-end planning, strategy, and release of weekly and monthly Binge planners, maintaining 100% schedule compliance. Ensure asset availability & required approvals for all releases and stunts, with turnaround within 48 hours. Collaborate with Marketing and Subs Comms teams to conceptualize and execute 1 monthly content-led campaign aimed at improving engagement and acquisition. Ensure regular curation and rotation of at least 1 special editorial curation and share monthly performance updates. Coordinate with vendors and partners to ensure on-time delivery of title marketing assets, banners, and thumbnails for programming and campaign especially for P0 & P1 launches.

name: Meghna Tiwari
description: Implement a unified strategy across mobile, TV & web; optimize visibility of key titles and stunts to improve user engagement from 60% to 65% and contribute to achieve company's target by Q4 FY25. Drive engagement for focus genres like Anime, Devotional, Retro, Sports, aiming to increase their contribution to total content plays by 10% each. Align with partner managers on 100% of monthly new releases and plan promotional support accordingly. Strengthen editorial and personalized programming on Tata Play Binge ensuring timely delivery of schedules 2 days in advance every week Trackingby leading daily and weekly new releases with 100% accuracy for P0& P1 and content curation across web, ATV, and FTV Lead 2+ genre/seasonal programming stunts per quarter — including ideation, cross-team execution, tracking performance uplift. Track and report on MAUs, MAVs, title-level performance, partner contribution, and consumption trends monthly.

name: Meghna Tiwari
description: Key content POC for 10+ partners, all internal teams, and external vendors — ensuring timely updates, programming syncs, and promotional alignment. Collaborate with NPD and Tech to improve user discoverability + ensuring content inputs feed into design and app rollout. Monthly Partner Syncs & Quaterly review with Manager: Host Monthly partner syncs to align on programming & promotional strategies which would help drive partner & genre consumption on the App Strengthen engagement with partners under my purview (BBC Player, VROTT, etc) by ensuring at least 2 quarterly check-ins and 100% adherence to programming and campaign calendars. Liaise with Legal & Finance to ensure content agreements and negotiations are smooth, timely, and in line with organizational objectives. Drive the successful end-to-end launch of Crunchyroll on Binge, ensuring closure of all onboarding, product, tech, UI, and comms requirements per the agreed timeline.

name: Meghna Tiwari
description: Drive atleast 1 product feature implementation that could aid acquisition & engagement (e.g. Dynamic Pinning, Cohorts, etc.) Monitor and evaluate 10+ partner and competitor platforms monthly, identifying special stunts, drops, and release changes. Lead new verticals like Anime, Devotion, and Short-Form content across Binge, driving 3 end-to-end campaigns through the year with 5–10% engagement uplift. Represent the Content team in internal reviews by preparing and presenting decks, status reports, and data snapshots. Content Team's Initiatives: Designing and creating newsletters that highlight our new releases, unique content, top-performers, etc.

name: Naveen Chandra Joshi
goal name: Availability & Problem Resolving in Technical Operations
description: 1. Ensure all services maintain 99.95% uptime for Baseband and Compression. 2. Ensure quick replacement for faulty headend devices to prevent outages. 3. Develop SOPs for fault isolation and recovery to minimize downtime. 4. Update details of any replace asset or change in Service parameters immediately after any changes. 5. Track services outages and A/V quality differences for benchmarking. 6. Identify frequent fault patterns and propose preventive measures.

name: Naveen Chandra Joshi
description: 1. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure timely escalation during outages, interference, or major events. name: Vikas Jangir
goal name: Analysis, Management, Configuration, Problem Resolving of Uplink & Downlink Chain
description: 1. Management of Uplink & Downlink Chain: Checking configuration and redundancy of Uplink Chain according to schedule & Provide resolution for all technical issues pertaining to RF Setup. 2. Management of Measuring & Spare equipment’s: Need to capture & analyze the issue observed in RF Uplink & Downlink setup timely & need to resolve issue in minimum time either by replacing equipment or by informing Broadcaster. 3. Uplink equipment failure: Configuring & replacing the faulty equipment of Uplink Chain with spare one. 4. Special Event Coverage: Arrange Satellite Downlink for any special event coverage on our platform. 5. Management of ASI signal to Diversity Site : Manage ASI traffic to Chennai via P2P lease line network of TCL/Vodafone / Airtel network .

name: Vikas Jangir
goal name: Health Checkup & Preventive Maintenance of RF Setup
description: 1. Preventive maintenance, Health check-up of RF setup timely & ensures spare equipment’s availability for Uplink setup. 2. Ensure that SOP's are followed for routine jobs to maintain standards and all preventive procedures are followed. 3. Coordination with Vendors/ OEM’s for all equipment’s or any specific issues observed in setup at Delhi & Chennai. 4. Monitoring our downlink signals for any interference/ spurious detection, Inform ISRO /NOCC & co-ordinate with them to resolve the issue. 5. Ensure that the RF databases are always updated and reference documents regularly revised. Keep track of issues & implemented changes for future reference.

name: Vikas Jangir
description: 1. Daily Margin Measurement report generation & analysis to ensure the proper downlink margin in the field. 2. Competitor Rain Outage setup & Report generation (daily, weekly & monthly) for 3 sites (Delhi, Mumbai & Chennai) during Monsoon. 3. Daily Antenna Graph generation for all Uplink antennae to check their proper movement. 4. Preparation of L-Band report on Monthly basis to keep check on downlink margins of broadcaster services & addition of new services. 5. Be updated of new Technologies implemented within RF set-up and maintain effective communication with Engineering, IT, & Consumer Products’ Teams for prompt escalation of specific problems.

name: T Sendil Kumar
goal name: IT Budget Management - Capex and Opex
description: "To ensure that the IT expenses are managed within approved AoP for both Capex and Opex. To liaise with finance team on AoP and budget review on timely manner or on demand from the party. Eliminating the needless expenses. To track additional business requirements flowing to IT GL and report same to finance and align with budget and respective stakeholders. Maintaining PRF tracker for Capex requirements and align each and every request with approved AoP line-item. Monitoring the expenses of Opex requests and report to top line management on cost variations. Coordinate with Finance team for request of additional budgets provided with need justification. Maintain a tracker to differentiate new opex requirements and BAU renewal requirements. Liaise with finance to manage non purchase order requirements. To coordinate with all stake holders to understand their Capex need for upcoming financial year and project AoP requirement to finance. To evaluate with all stake holders to understand their renewal and new opex need for upcoming financial year and project AoP requirement to finance. Monitor and report the month-on-month cost expenses incurred for AWS. Bench-marking the CAPEX & OPEX cost and closing the same within the budget."

description: "Proactively publish the AMC renewal details to internal user and to liaise with requirement stakeholders to fulfill their IT needs. To liaise with SCM team for delivering IT purchase needs. Understanding the requirements from stakeholders, evaluating the need, and fulfilling the requirements on-time with best service provider and better cost optimization. Understanding the importance of requirements and impact of business for any cost saving opportunities. Coordinate with OEM, & Vendors to track the order statuses and delivery fulfilment. Supporting vendors for timely payment release upon completion of services as per agreed timeline to maintain company reputation. To ensure that business services are not impacted for any reason. Evaluating, fulfilling, tracking and reporting of non PRF and non purchase order requirements. Eliminating the needless expenses. Monitoring of service dates in asset portal for all hardware, software and support services."

name: Kumar Gaurav
goal name: A. Monitoring, Fault Escalations and Technical operations.
description: 1. Downlink Monitoring tools: Ensure all services are visible on the video wall. Use alarms (via KX and Sentry) for Downlink/Uplink signals to alert within 30 Sec of any outage. 2. Alarm System/Trap Management: Configure and manage Dektec, Sentry and Spectrum Analyzer tools to use to monitor Transport Streams and pull system logs. 3. Fault/Event logging: Log every outage in MCR software with details like downtime and RCA. Send emails to Co-tech, Leadership and Broadcaster as per the escalation Matrix. 4. FSD, Broadcasters and other Escalations: Respond to all issues within 15 mins, escalate technology related issues to the appropriate teams promptly. 5. Competitor Monitoring: Track competitor services and note down outages or A/V quality differences for benchmarking. 6. Service Availability: Maintain 99.95 % uptime across Baseband, Compression and Receive end chains. Ensure all services meet Broadcast Standard

name: Kumar Gaurav
goal name: B. Headend operations, Database, SOP Update & Reports generation
description: 1. Service Execution: Perform Service Launch, Drop and modification as per the CR raised and follow checklists and share updates with stakeholders in the same shift. 2. Report Generation: Create and share Shift/ daily/weekly/monthly as schedule. Ensure reports are verified and shared with relevant teams on time. 3. Database Management: Update Monitoring, Compression and Baseband details update immediately after any changes. Use work orders and alerts to plan future works (Internal or Broadcaster related) 4. SOP Compliance: Folow SOP for all routing tasks and share Checklist updates. Share pending tasks via mail or handover tool. Revise SOPs whenever workflow changes. 5. Service Quality Checks: Validate and coordinate on any quality, Signal or Technical changes observed. Confirmed data accuracy with concerned Stakeholders. 6. Live activities: Providing support to Broadcasters, Content, Interactive teams during Live Events, Blocking Matches, Routing Informatory Slates and share recordings of Commercials on Geo based bouquets.

name: Kumar Gaurav
description: 1. Baseband Device Management: Manage PIRDs, routers, DA, ACO devices for redundancy and signal availability. Keep backup chains active to avoid outages. 2. Device Configuration & Upgrades: Configure or upgrade all active/baseband units like PIRDs and peripherals. Regularly health checkup and install the latest software updates. 3. Systems Management: Maintain availability of CG and logo motion machines. Update device sheets including licenses and features. Track and log all issues related to devices (routers, CG, delay card, logo motion). 4. Additional reports: Mention details of assigned reports.

Keep backups ready, monitor alarms on encoders, MUX, nCC, and switches, and address outages as per SOP to reduce downtime. 4. Additional reports: Verifying and updating MCR Systems details.

goal name: Headend operations, Database, SOP Update & Reports generation
description: 1. Service Execution: Perform Service Launch, Drop and modification as per the CR raised and follow checklists and share updates with stakeholders in the same shift. 2. Report Generation: Create and share Shift/ daily/weekly/monthly as schedule. Ensure reports are verified and shared with relevant teams on time. 3. Database Management: Update Monitoring, Compression and Baseband details update immediately after any changes. Use work orders and alerts to plan future works (Internal or Broadcaster related) 4. SOP Compliance: Folow SOP for all routing tasks and share Checklist updates. Share pending tasks via mail or handover tool. Revise SOPs whenever workflow changes. 5. Service Quality Checks: Validate and coordinate on any quality, Signal or Technical changes observed. Confirmed data accuracy with concerned Stakeholders. 6. Live activities: Providing support to Broadcasters, Content, Interactive teams during Live Events, Blocking Matches, Routing Informatory Slates and share recordings of Commercials on Geo based bouquets.

name: Himanshu Garkoti
goal name: Monitoring, Fault Escalations and Technical operations
description: 1. Downlink Monitoring tools: Ensure all services are visible on the video wall. Use alarms (via KX and Sentry) for Downlink/Uplink signals to alert within 30 Sec of any outage. 2. Alarm System/Trap Management: Configure and manage Dektec, Sentry and Spectrum Analyzer tools to use to monitor Transport Streams and pull system logs. 3. Fault/Event logging: Log every outage in MCR software with details like downtime and RCA. Send emails to Co-tech, Leadership and Broadcaster as per the escalation Matrix. 4. FSD, Broadcasters and other Escalations: Respond to all issues within 15 mins, escalate technology related issues to the appropriate teams promptly. 5. Competitor Monitoring: Track competitor services and note down outages or A/V quality differences for benchmarking. 6. Service Availability: Maintain 99.95 % uptime across Baseband, Compression and Receive end chains. Ensure all services meet Broadcast Standard

name: Rameez Ahmad Ansari
description: 1. Baseband Device Management: Manage PIRDs, routers, DA, ACO devices for redundancy and signal availability. Keep backup chains active to avoid outages. 2. Device Configuration & Upgrades: Configure or upgrade all active/baseband units like PIRDs and peripherals. Regularly health checkup and install the latest software updates. 3. Systems Management: Maintain availability of CG and logo motion machines. Update device sheets including licenses and features. Track and log all issues related to devices (routers, CG, delay card, logo motion). 4. Additional reports: Mention details of assigned reports.

name: Rameez Ahmad Ansari
goal name: Headend operations, Database, SOP Update & Reports generation
description: 1. Service Execution: Perform Service Launch, Drop and modification as per the CR raised and follow checklists and share updates with stakeholders in the same shift. 2. Report Generation: Create and share Shift/ daily/weekly/monthly as schedule. Ensure reports are verified and shared with relevant teams on time. 3. Database Management: Update Monitoring, Compression and Baseband details update immediately after any changes. Use work orders and alerts to plan future works (Internal or Broadcaster related) 4. SOP Compliance: Folow SOP for all routing tasks and share Checklist updates. Share pending tasks via mail or handover tool. Revise SOPs whenever workflow changes. 5. Service Quality Checks: Validate and coordinate on any quality, Signal or Technical changes observed. Confirmed data accuracy with concerned Stakeholders. 6. Live activities: Providing support to Broadcasters, Content, Interactive teams during Live Events, Blocking Matches, Routing Informatory Slates and share recordings of Commercials on Geo based bouquets.

name: Rameez Ahmad Ansari
goal name: Monitoring, Fault Escalations and Technical operations
description: 1. Downlink Monitoring tools: Ensure all services are visible on the video wall. Use alarms (via KX and Sentry) for Downlink/Uplink signals to alert within 30 Sec of any outage. 2. Alarm System/Trap Management: Configure and manage Dektec, Sentry and Spectrum Analyzer tools to use to monitor Transport Streams and pull system logs. 3. Fault/Event logging: Log every outage in MCR software with details like downtime and RCA. Send emails to Co-tech, Leadership and Broadcaster as per the escalation Matrix. 4. FSD, Broadcasters and other Escalations: Respond to all issues within 15 mins, escalate technology related issues to the appropriate teams promptly. 5. Competitor Monitoring: Track competitor services and note down outages or A/V quality differences for benchmarking. 6. Service Availability: Maintain 99.95 % uptime across Baseband, Compression and Receive end chains. Ensure all services meet Broadcast Standard

name: Harsh Gill
goal name: Grow Holding & Revenue for Devotion portfolio
description: Aradhana i) Identify and bring newer big-ticket properties similar to Kumbh, Lalbaug etc. to improve churn and consolidate the holding gained in previous year. ii) Deep dive into consumer viewership and subscription patterns during marquee events to enhance programming and promotion for upcoming events. iii) Add newer partnership opportunities, and trending Gurus for their content, explore contests and other value add features. Ibaadat i) Key target to arrest the churn and consolidate the base. Deep dive into consumer preferences through primary and secondary research and rework the service position & programming accordingly. ii) Negotiating addition of Mecca Madina content this FY to fuel further growth. Deiveegam i) In-depth analysis of content demand and consumption pattern and revise the service proposition basis acquired data. ii) Primary consumer research, analyzing consumer trends and implementation of corrections measures to drive engagement and retention. iii) Utilize TPMA for segmented promotions for acquisition of new subscribers and for engagement & retention purpose as well. Darshan To revamp Darshan as a paid service from its existing free avatar and oversee smooth and uninterrupted coverage of the service across linear, TPMA and Binge and collaborate and offer solutions to all stakeholder teams when needed,

name: Harsh Gill
goal name: New Service Launch - Bhabhiji IP service
description: Pre-Launch: i) Primary & secondary consumer research, BARC analysis for uptake, consumer willingness to pay for the service etc. ii) Create a robust plan for all launch deliverables (internal and partner). Launch: Finalizing LCN, bandwidth and port requirements, content ingestion, FPC, EPG, Interactive schedule, TPMA ops (Live TV & VOD), website creation, launch deck, service testing, and alignment of internal and external stakeholders for promotions. Post launch: i) Studying subscriber and viewership data, buying trends along with consumer research post launch to drive future product and content strategy. ii) Regular collaborations over monthly promotions, programming, performance reviews with all stakeholders for continuous improvement and consumer growth.

name: Harsh Gill
description: Exploration of new services: Ideate and analyze new service launch ideas and execute product strategy/new experiments on existing services. Services on Binge: Launch and manage Specials app on Binge, from content strategy to programming to build presence and exposure. Budget: Maintain budget requirements and details for all in-house services. TTN: Services SPOC for all services & projects. Competition Tracker & Monthly Newsletter: Create insightful competition update that would drive future business strategies and course of actions.

name: Harsh Gill
goal name: Sustain Holding & Revenue for Bollywood Masala at 125k, Classic Cinema at 270k & Bollywood Premiere at 200k
description: Classic Cinema i) Address the balance of movies library (from more B/W public domain titles to a more balanced mix of colour titles from 70s & 80s) along with additions of newer shows and songs. ii) Deep dive into subscriber analysis, consumer research, creating new initiatives to add back previous subscribers, new ones who haven't held any service in minimum a year, etc. iii) Linear consumption and BARC analysis to drive future product and content enhancements. Bollywood Masala i) Enhancing the overall product proposition basis consumer feedback, genre analysis on linear, new value ads like increasing OTT presence, Bollywood bundles, new OB initiatives to further drive growth and retention. ii) Addition of more 90's titles and fulfillment of Year 2 content requirements and addition of new ancillary shows and songs. Bollywood Premiere i) Identifying marquee content available with other broadcastors and push the partner for its acquisition. iii) Researching competition linear channels for programming, consumption etc. to drive product and programming strategy during absence of marquee premieres. Ii) Building the VOD library which is a priority especially with big premieres not added regularly. iii) Consumer research to drive growth and retention.

name: Harsh Gill
goal name: Sustain Holding & Revenue for Seniors at 75k, Smart Games at 35k and Optimize Cooking at 20k

Enforce secure access to data by ensuring 100% of data access via RBAC(Role Based AC)/ABAC(Attribute Based AC) by periodic reviews every quarter. 4. Data Encryption - Ensure 100% of Dataset encryption applied at rest(Storage) and In-transit(SSL), Key management best practices like KMS - Sep 2025. 5. Reduce Data Exposure risk by ensuring Data masking - protect 100% PII data with AES 256 masking technique or similar and not to share files by any mode of other channels other than only by enabling password protection zip files.

name: Komal Bhandari
description: 1. Automate TCOC E-learning training module for primary for all new employees and refresher training module for all the existing employees 2. Revamp / update the training & induction deck to communicate about TCOC and importance of Ethics in the organization. 3. Be the point of contact for addressing queries pertaining to concerns of employees related to COI/ other relevant matters related to Ethics. 4. To ensure any update/change in Ethics related policies on the Tata Play Universe. 5. Revision/ updating banners / posters with the new Whistle-blower helpline across offices. 6. Prepare periodic Ethics Case status report for top management 7. Assist CEC with ACR filing and LBE Survey/ action plan for the year. 8. Celebrating Ethics Week to educate employees on ethical standard and reporting mechanisms along to reinforce TCOC values. 9. Benchmark ethics practices with Tata group companies 10. Timely share the informative mails from Ethics committee on Festive season, gifts and hospitality, change in policy, web portal, new policies etc.

name: Komal Bhandari
description: 1. Investigate the complaints / cases received from various sources (Whistle blower hotline/Internal/Third parties/RA) 2. Assist CEC and EC members in open interview with the alleged individuals additionally by providing case summary and evidence dosier a day before every interview or updated on teams channel. 3. Collaborate with legal, HR, and authorities for critical case insights and documents. 4. Understand the requirement and provide external consultants with all the relevant documents as required for the investigation and guide with the way forward on the investigation basis process understanding 5. Preparation of the investigation report(s) along with recommendations to management and share the same relevant stake holders and track the same for the closure of MAPs. 6. Maintaining the ethics tracker upto date and proper repository of all the matters with adequate proofs and action points along with timelines of events and update the same on teams channel 7. name: Kapil Kumar
description: 1) Working on downlink chain to improve reception D/L margin. 2) Make a monitoring chain in the RF room is used to immediately identify issues. 3) Managing L Band report to check MER of all downlink services. 4) Working on remote control of remain equipment to manage them.

name: Kapil Kumar
goal name: Analysis, Management, Configuration, Problem Resolving of Uplink & Downlink Chain
description: 1. Management of Uplink & Downlink Chain: Checking configuration and redundancy of Uplink Chain according to schedule & Provide resolution for all technical issues pertaining to RF Setup. 2. Management of Measuring & Spare equipment’s: Need to capture & analyze the issue observed in RF Uplink & Downlink setup timely & need to resolve issue in minimum time either by replacing equipment or by informing Broadcaster. 3. Uplink equipment failure: Configuring & replacing the faulty equipment of Uplink Chain with spare one. 4. Special Event Coverage: Arrange Satellite Downlink for any special event coverage on our platform. 5. Management of ASI signal to Diversity Site : Manage ASI traffic to Chennai via P2P lease line network of TCL/Vodafone / Airtel network .

name: Kapil Kumar
goal name: Health Checkup & Preventive Maintenance of RF Setup
description: 1. Preventive maintenance, Health check-up of RF setup timely & ensures spare equipment’s availability for Uplink setup. 2. Ensure that SOP's are followed for routine jobs to maintain standards and all preventive procedures are followed. 3. Coordination with Vendors/ OEM’s for all equipment’s or any specific issues observed in setup at Delhi & Chennai. 4. Monitoring our downlink signals for any interference/ spurious detection, Inform ISRO /NOCC & co-ordinate with them to resolve the issue. 5. Ensure that the RF databases are always updated and reference documents regularly revised. Keep track of issues & implemented changes for future reference.

name: Kapil Kumar
description: 1. Daily Margin Measurement report generation & analysis to ensure the proper downlink margin in the field. 2. Competitor Rain Outage setup & Report generation (daily, weekly & monthly) for 3 sites (Delhi, Mumbai & Chennai) during Monsoon. 3. Daily Antenna Graph generation for all Uplink antennae to check their proper movement. 4. Preparation of L-Band report on Monthly basis to keep check on downlink margins of broadcaster services & addition of new services. 5. Be updated of new Technologies implemented within RF set-up and maintain effective communication with Engineering, IT, & Consumer Products’ Teams for prompt escalation of specific problems.
